com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.mixer
Class MixerJoinTest

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.TestBase
              com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.MediaSessionBase
                  com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.mixer.MixerJoinTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class MixerJoinTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Testcases joining a MediaMixer to one or multiple NetworkConnections.
Varying the number of objects, the join Direction, unjoin, re-join, etc.
All test methods use a ContinuityChecker, with various configurations.

Method Detail

test_2_1_6_1_BasicBridge

public void test_2_1_6_1_BasicBridge()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Bridge two calls through a mixer.
Create a MediaMixer (no parameters) and two SipPhoneEmulator.
Joins both phones in DUPLEX.
Play on one phone a file containing a DTMF, and verify that the DTMF is received on the other phone.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_2_ThreeWaysBridge

public void test_2_1_6_2_ThreeWaysBridge()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Connect 3 SipPhoneEmulator on a Mixer.
Create a MediaMixer (no parameters) and 3 SipPhoneEmulator.
Joins all phones in DUPLEX.
Play on one phone a file containing a DTMF, and verify that the DTMF is received on the 2 other phones.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_3_FiveWaysSplitter

public void test_2_1_6_3_FiveWaysSplitter()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Same as test_2_1_6_2_ThreeWaysBridge() with 1+5 phones.
All phones are joined in DUPLEX to the single Mixer.
Each SipPhoneEmulator is tested as a sender, the other being receivers

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_4_UnjoinedBridge

public void test_2_1_6_4_UnjoinedBridge()
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Check that unjoin actually blocks media stream.
Create a MediaMixer (no parameters) and two SipPhoneEmulator, one sender and one receiver.
Joins both phones in DUPLEX on the MediaMixer.
Unjoin the receiver phone
Play on one phone a file containing a DTMF, and verify that the DTMF is not received on the other phone. 
 1) sender <--> Mixer
 2) sender <--> Mixer <--> receiver
 3) sender <--> Mixer      receiver
Operations:
sender.join(DUPLEX, Mixer);
receiver.join(DUPLEX, Mixer);
receiver.unjoin(Mixer);

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_8_BasicBridgeRecvOK

public void test_2_1_6_8_BasicBridgeRecvOK()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Check that joining in Direction.RECV actually blocks the mediastream in one direction.
Create a MediaMixer (no parameters) and two SipPhoneEmulator, one sender and one receiver.
Joins the sender in DUPLEX and the receiver in RECV.
Play on the sender a file containing a DTMF, and verify that the DTMF is received on the receiver phone. 
 1) sender <--> Mixer
 2) sender <--> Mixer  --> receiver
Operations:
sender.join(DUPLEX, Mixer);
receiver.join(RECV, Mixer);

The media must go through.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_9_BasicBridgeRecvNOK

public void test_2_1_6_9_BasicBridgeRecvNOK()
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Same as test_2_1_6_8_BasicBridgeRecvOK(), with sender in RECV. 
 1) sender <-- Mixer
 2) sender <-- Mixer <--> receiver
. Operations:
sender.join(RECV, Mixer)
receiver.join(DUPLEX, Mixer)

The media must not go through.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_10_BasicBridgeRejoinRecvNOK

public void test_2_1_6_10_BasicBridgeRejoinRecvNOK()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Same as test_2_1_6_9_BasicBridgeRecvNOK(), but the sender is joined DUPLEX first, and then RECV. 
 1) sender <--> Mixer
 2) sender <--  Mixer
 3) sender <--  Mixer <--> receiver
Operations:
sender.join(DUPLEX, Mixer);
sender.join(RECV, Mixer);
receiver.join(DUPLEX, Mixer);

The media must not go through.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_6_11_BasicBridgeUnMute

public void test_2_1_6_11_BasicBridgeUnMute()
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Check that after being muted (RECV), the sender can be set on normal again (DUPLEX) and send media. 
 1) sender <--  Mixer
 2) sender <--  Mixer <--> receiver
 3) sender <--> Mixer <--> receiver

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
